As Tong Chi Ming, if I were to set up a snack factory in the UK, here is what I would do next:

1. Conduct market research: I would research the snack market in the UK to determine what types of snacks are in demand and what types of snacks are missing from the market.
2. Develop a business plan: Based on my research, I would develop a detailed business plan that outlines my vision, goals, target market, marketing strategy, production processes, and financial projections.
3. Secure funding: I would seek out potential investors or apply for a business loan to secure the necessary funding to start my factory.
4. Obtain necessary permits and licenses: I would make sure to obtain all necessary permits and licenses to operate my factory in the UK.
5. Hire a team: I would recruit and hire a team of experienced professionals in the snack industry to help me launch and run my factory.
6. Choose a location: I would carefully select a location for my factory that is conveniently located and easily accessible to my target market.
7. Purchase equipment and supplies: I would purchase all the necessary equipment and supplies to set up and run my factory, including packaging materials, ingredients, and machinery.
8. Launch the factory: With all the preparations in place, I would launch my snack factory and start producing high-quality snacks for the UK market.

As Tong Chi Ming, the timescale for setting up a snack factory in the UK can vary depending on various factors, such as the size of the factory, the scope of the project, and the level of experience of the team involved. Here is a rough estimate of the timescale for setting up a snack factory in the UK:

1. Conducting market research and developing a business plan can take 1-3 months.
2. Securing funding can take several months, depending on the funding source and the complexity of the project.
3. Obtaining necessary permits and licenses can take 1-2 months, depending on the specific requirements and regulations.
4. Recruiting and hiring a team can take several weeks to several months, depending on the level of expertise required.
5. Choosing a location can take several weeks to several months, depending on the availability of suitable properties.
6. Purchasing equipment and supplies can take several weeks to several months, depending on the availability and lead times of the required items.
7. Launching the factory can take several weeks to several months, depending on the level of preparation and the complexity of the production processes.

Overall, the process of setting up a snack factory in the UK requires careful planning, attention to detail, and a significant amount of time and effort. However, with the right approach and a committed team, it can be a rewarding and successful venture.
